IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: A COEDUCATIONAL, COLLEGE PREPARATORY NON-SECTARIAN INDEPENDENT SCHOOL FOR GRADES TK-12.
IRS990.MissionDescription: GREENSBORO DAY SCHOOL DEVELOPS THE INTELLECTUAL, ETHICAL, AND INTERPERSONAL FOUNDATIONS STUDENTS NEED TO BECOME CONSTRUCTIVE CONTRIBUTORS TO THE WORLD.
IRS990.Description: THE SCHOOL IS COMMITTED TO PROVIDING TO OUR STUDENTS A CHALLENGING AND INSPIRING ACADEMIC PROGRAM THAT SUPPORTS STUDENTS IN ACHIEVING THEIR POTENTIAL IN COLLEGE AND LIFE, A SOCIALLY AND ECONOMICALLY DIVERSE COMMUNITY THAT HONORS AND NURTURES RELATIONSHIPS AMONG STUDENTS, FACULTY AND COMMUNITY , AN EXCEPTIONAL EXTRA-CURRICULAR OPPORTUNITY THAT ENRICHES THE EDUCATIONAL EXPERIENCE AND A GLOBAL PERSPECTIVE THAT CULTIVATES RESPECT FOR OTHERS AND PROMOTES STEWARDSHIP OF THE ENVIRONMENT.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Intended Use of Endowment Funds:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION'S ENDOWMENT CONSISTS OF APPROXIMATELY 65 INDIVIDUAL FUNDS ESTABLISHED FOR A VARIETY OF PURPOSES.
PLEDGE RESERVE AND WRITE OFF: 12872. SWAP AGREEMENT LOSS: -78097.

IRS990ScheduleE.PubViaBroadcastMediaExpln: THE NONDISCRIMINATION POLICY IS PRINTED ANNUALLY IN THE LOCAL NEWSPAPER.

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Identifier: Procedure for Monitoring Grants in the U.S.:
Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2: THE ORGANIZATION HAS SET PROCEDURES FOR DETERMINING THE FINANCIAL NEED OF STUDENTS WHO ARE APPLYING FOR FINANCIAL AID AND THE GRANTING OF FINANCIAL AID. ELIGIBLE STUDENTS ARE CHOSEN AS GRANT RECIPIENTS BASED ON FINANCIAL NEED.

Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Explanation: TRAVEL FOR COMPANIONS, TAX INDEMNIFICATION AND GROSS UP PAYMENTS, HOUSING ALLOWANCE, AND HEALTH CLUB DUES ARE PAID FOR THE HEAD OF THE SCHOOL AND ARE APPROPRIATELY INCLUDED IN HIS WAGES.

Form990ScheduleLPartIV.Relationship: BUSINESS OWNED BY BOARD MEMBER'S SPOUSE

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 6
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: ANY INDIVIDUAL WHO HAS PURCHASED A MEMBERSHIP CERTIFICATE, IS GRANTED ONE PURSUANT TO THE CORPORATION'S FINANCIAL AID PROGRAM OR WHO RECEIVES A RECEIPT FOR PAYING A NEW STUDENT FEE (NS FEE) SHALL AUTOMATICALLY BECOME A MEMBER OF THE CORPORATION. THE PURCHASE PRICE OF A MEMBERSHIP CERTIFICATE, THE AMOUNT OF THE NS FEE, AND QUALIFICATIONS FOR FINANCIAL AID SHALL BE SET BY THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES. BEGINNING WITH THE 2003 - 2004 ACADEMIC YEAR OF THE SCHOOL, ANY PARENT OR GUARDIAN OF ONE OR MORE CHILDREN ENROLLED IN THE SCHOOL SHALL AUTOMATICALLY BE A MEMBER OF THE CORPORATION WITHOUT FURTHER ACTION. MEMBERS OF THE CORPORATION SHALL HAVE NO VOTING RIGHTS.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 7a
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE BOARD RECOGNIZES THE LONG-STANDING HISTORY OF SIGNIFICANT CONTRIBUTIONS MADE BY THE PARENTS' ASSOCIATION TO THE BETTERMENT OF THE SCHOOL AND ALSO RECOGNIZES THAT ACTIVE PARTICIPATION IN THE PARENTS' ASSOCIATION IS AN INDICATION OF THE TIME, EFFORT AND COMMITMENT WHICH ARE DESIRABLE IN AN EFFECTIVE BOARD MEMBER. ACCORDINGLY, THE COMMITTEE ON TRUSTEES SHALL SEEK A LIST OF POTENTIAL NOMINEES EACH YEAR FROM THE PARENTS ASSOCIATION NOMINATING COMMITTEE. THE CHAIRMAN OF THE COMMITTEE ON TRUSTEES SHALL SERVE AS A NON-VOTING MEMBER OF THE PARENTS ASSOCIATION NOMINATING COMMITTEE FOR PURPOSES OF THIS SELECTION PROCESS. THE PARENTS' ASSOCIATION NOMINATING COMMITTEE SHALL THEN IDENTIFY A NUMBER OF POTENTIAL BOARD NOMINEES WHO IT BELIEVES WILL FILL THE NEEDS OF THE BOARD AND WILL BE EFFECTIVE BOARD MEMBERS. THE CHAIRMAN OF THE PARENTS' ASSOCIATION NOMINATING COMMITTEE AND THE CHAIRMAN OF THE COMMITTEE ON TRUSTEES WILL THEN COMMUNICATE THE LIST OF THESE PROPOSED NOMINEES TO THE COMMITTEE ON TRUSTEES FOR THEIR CONSIDERATION. IN TURN, THE COMMITTEE ON TRUSTEES SHALL ANNUALLY SELECT FROM AMONG THIS LIST A NOMINEE TO BE INCLUDED IN THE FINAL SLATE. IN ADDITION, THE PRESIDENT OF THE PARENTS' ASSOCIATION SHALL SERVE ON THE BOARD FOR A ONE-YEAR TERM AS A VOTING MEMBER AND THE PRESIDENT-ELECT OF THE PARENTS' ASSOCIATION SHALL BE INVITED TO ATTEND BOARD MEETINGS AS A NON-VOTING OBSERVER FOR THE ONE-YEAR TERM AS PRESIDENT-ELECT. EFFECTIVE MAY 18, 2010, THE SCHOOL ELIMINATED THE REQUIREMENT THAT THE PARENT'S ASSOCIATION SELECT A MEMBER OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE FORM 990 WAS REVIEWED BY THE AUDIT COMMITTEE AND SENT ELECTRONICALLY TO ALL VOTING MEMBERS OF THE BOARD. THE FULL BOARD THEN REVIEWED AND APPROVED THE 990 AT A BOARD MEETING PRIOR TO FILING THE FORM.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: EACH BOARD MEMBER, OFFICER, AND KEY EMPLOYEE IS GIVEN A COPY OF THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND IS ASKED TO SIGN A STATEMENT ANNUALLY THAT HE OR SHE HAS NOT ENTERED INTO ANY ARRANGEMENTS WITH THE SCHOOL AND ITS CONSTITUANTS THAT WOULD VIOLATE THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE COMPENSATION OF KEY EMPLOYEES AND OFFICERS IS REVIEWED ANNUALLY AGAINST COMPARABLE DATA. THE DETERMINED COMPENSATION IS THEN REVIEWED AND APPROVED BY THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES COMPENSATION COMMITTEE. THIS COMMITTEE IS CHAIRED BY THE CHAIRMAN OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES AND INCLUDES THE CHAIR-ELECT OR VICE CHAIR OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES, THE AUDIT COMMITTEE CHAIR AND THE COMMITTEE ON TRUSTEES CHAIR. IT IS CHARGED WITH REVIEWING COMPARABLE COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS DATA FOR THE HEAD OF SCHOOL AND KEY EMPLOYEES AS SPECIFIED BY THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE CHARTER.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE MADE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.
